column4: hi there, how /var/cache/apt/available can be rebuilt if 'apt-get update' does not do its job?
can't you just rerun apt-get update?
i'm telling you apt-get update does *not* work ;)
Oh. What error you are getting?
i get no no error, it says rebuilding the file at the end, but it won't
and you know that it doesn't rebuild by how?
by having *not* that file no longer
yeah. I guess that does mean it :)
well I don't have that file either. Doesn't apt-get no longer work?
exactly that, i get "E: The package index files are corrupted. No Filename: field for package whatever"
I have archives -directory, pkgcache.bin (6.3M), srcpkgcache.bin (6.1M) in /var/cache/apt. You don't have that pkgcache.bin?
yes, i have both
are you using breezy or hoary?
and those are rebuilt just fine with update
breezy here
That is interesting. Do you have any extra repositories installed that aren't in normal installation?
oh, sorry, i think i found the problem, one of the packages suffers from a bug on packaging itself
yeah. Which one?
but still, i'm coming from debian... is there no more 'available' file for apt no more?
hwtools
it would seem that no. I don't know about these things really :)
ok, thx anyway
hwtools is in normal breezy installation.. hmm. You should think about filing a bug report.
thx for the tip, but i think i might pin it, since the broken one is coming from an external repo, ubuntu is not to blame this time :)
